It was a dark and stormy night, but isn’t it always with these sort of stories? The rain was coming down hard as three young guys try to make their way home. Alex, Sam, and Zack were on their way back from a swim meet that ended with them not only losing, but losing bad. Maybe the other teams where just better, maybe they need to practice more but what ever the reason, their spirits were low.

Sam slapped Alex’s hand as he tried to change the station.

“My car, my music” Sam announced, like it was his catchphrase.

“If I had known that I would have drove, you have awful tastes” Alex proclaimed with disgust.

Zack sat in the backseat, staring out the window. He hadn't said much since they left. He cound't help but feel like the other two blamed him for their dreadful time. He just kept dwelling on how miserable he did.

The radio was in the middle of a car insurance commercial when the car stalled out.

Sam tried to turn the engine but there was no sign of life in the thing.

“I really should have drove” Alex said matter of factly.

“I just got this thing out of the shop, there is no reason for Thor to be acting up.” Sam said befuddled.

“You named your car Thor?”

“You know, because it’s a dodge avenger”

“Nerd.”

“Whatever,” Sam took out his phone. “Someone pass me their phone, I’m not getting signal”

Alex did the same and got the same results “same here, Zack what about you?”

Zack wasn’t really listening; he was just steady watching the rain fall. While drifting he could swear he saw a light blink.

“Hey, space cadet! Phone!”

Zack was started but quickly regained his composure and did the same as the other two with a similar outcome.
“Satellite must be down or something. Crap, I don't want to sleep in the car.”

Looking out the window, Zack once again could swear he saw something. “Guys, I think there’s something out there,” Zack says while motioning in the direction of the lights.

Sam looked out. “There shouldn’t be, there’s nothing but woods for…” Sam found himself cut buy a flash of lighting. The darkness was lifted for only a moment but long enough for them to see the imposing looking manor on a hill.

“Maybe we could ask to use their phone so we can call AAA.” Sam contemplating.

“Beats staying in here” Agreed Alex.

Zack shifted his weight and yelled over the storm, “Maybe they’re asleep?”

Sam was about to respond when the door slowly creaked open. They gave each other a cautious look before Sam stepped into the darkened entrance followed by the other two. The room was pitch black, no sign of light anywhere.

Zack whispered, “I don’t think we should be in –“

“Hello?!” Sam shouted, ignoring Zack’s concern. There was no response other then a slight echo. Though their phones seemed useless for contacting anyone, they still made semi-useful flashlights. They searched the area with their cells’ tiny lights revealing dust covered sheets draped over furniture.

“Looks like no one has been here for some time,” Alex mused.

“Fantastic, we were better off in the car, I’m freezing now.” Sam bellowed.

Zack was scanning the walls, eventually coming a crossed a light switch. He flipped the switch expecting it not to work, having long been shut off by now. To his surprise, however, the room was illuminated.

Sam and Alex let curiosity drag them along and began uncovering things, sending dust into the air. The main hall had everything you’d expect to see: chairs, coffee table, big clocks, there was even a large creepy portrait of a Black haired woman sitting on a chair with a brown haired man standing behind her, touching her shoulders. The main feature of the room was the two staircases leading to a balcony.

The room was quite until Alex spoke up, “We should split up.”

Sam lifted an eye brow, “zoinks scoob, lets go check out that groovy pantry.”

Zack shrugged, “Yea, I don’t think that’s a good idea. We should stick together so-“

Alex once again cut Zack off, “so the monsters don’t get us? Given me a break. I’m going to see if I can find a phone, if the lights work maybe the phone line does too. If you two are too scared then go ahead and stay here holding each others hands.”

With that, Alex took off into the depths of the house.

He wandered the halls quietly for a few more minutes when he heard faint voices, they were getting closer. It was Sam and Zack, Alex quickly ducked into the closest room to him to find...

"there's nobody but Alex here, and he went the other way, I'm going to look for him, you do what you want. "Sam said, trying to be a leader as always.

1121311212111.title: 5 years old

113.content:
"Alex has a point, at least," Sam mused. "It's just a dusty old house, and we can cover a lot more ground if we split up. Plus if you're so afraid Zack, you can just stay put!" Zack's stomach was too busy growling to let him pay attention otherwise. "But I'm hungry..." he sighed. "Maybe you should go check out the pantry then, I bet that's where they hide the Scooby Snacks!" Sam chuckled to himself. "Make me a sandwich while you're back there too," he bellowed as he walked off into the yet unknown depths of the house.

Zack was having none of this. Not only was he still upset at himself for performing terribly at the swim meet, but now he was stuck in a creepy house with two of his friends that probably hated him at this point. Dejected, he wandered towards what looked like the kitchen.

The counter top glistened as the lights flickered on, beaming down against the brown speckled marble. Zack shuffled around a few of the shelves only to find large sums of dust and no signs of life. Silently he kept hoping to find something, anything to eat, but started to wonder what kind of food would even keep in an old abandoned looking mansion.

As he poked his head in through the pantry doors, though, he noticed it was stocked full of goodies as far as the eye could see! Was this a cruel prank or a generous gift? Inspecting the box top of some cookies, he noticed that the expiration date was many months from today. Perhaps somebody still lived here? ... Maybe they wouldn't mind losing just a few cookies, too?

Zack rummaged around a few more cupboards before finding a set of gorgeous dinner plates, setting himself up a spread of treats: a handful of cookies, a fresh looking banana, and a warm cheese sandwich he managed to cobble together. Just as he started to stuff his face with food, a figure appeared out from a side of the room. Her focus was square on the shelves and sprawling counter in front of her as if she was... cleaning them? She seemed to glide across the kitchen and as if satisfied with her work, turned around before noticing Zack holding a bitten into sandwich. It was now he could make out her features, that of a very old looking woman in an even older looking maid's uniform.

Her face's wrinkles scrunched up as she looked closer at Zack. "A bit early for your break time, isn't it dear?"
113.title: Sam Leaves Zack alone in the room

1132.content:
Zack could barely breathe. 'Who was this woman, and what was she doing here? Did someone live here after all? Was she going to m-m-murder him?' As all these questions tried to flood his mind instead of this crippling fear welling up, the sandwich he was holding slipped out of his hands, toppling into his carefully planned plate of goodies and spilling everything onto the floor into a pile of crumbs and plate pieces. "Honestly now..." the old woman sighed. "You act as if you've seen a ghost."

She bends down and starts to sweep up the discarded food. "At least give me a hand, wouldn't you sweetie?" Her tone seemed both annoyed and exhausted. Zack shook his head, snapping himself out of the trance and bent down to pick up a shard of plate. "Oww!" The shard fell back to the floor as blood started dripping from his thumb. The old woman sighed seeming even more annoyed. "Maybe you should have taken a nap instead. Right this way..." she said, dragging Zack out of the kitchen and into the next room. She sat him down into a nearby chair, rummaging around a cabinet's contents before procuring some medical supplies.

The room itself was quite bare and just as dusty as the rest of the house. A few more of these tall cabinets, chairs scattered about, and even some changing screens. After his thumb was bandaged up, he stood up to leave, perhaps even run away. The old lady stopped him before any of these things could happen. Her wrinkles twitched in thought. "By the way dear... " she mused, tugging on his jacket. "Where is your uniform?" Zack was even more confused. "M-my what?" A smile parted her wrinkled face. "Ah! So she does speak! Your maid's uniform, of course." As Zack tried to explain what was going on or that he wasn't a she, the woman shook her head. "No matter, you are lucky a spare was left in here."

She motioned as Zack finally looked inside the large cabinet. Towards the bottom he noticed the bandages and antiseptic sticking out of an open drawer, with a handful of closed drawers. As his eyes wandered up he noticed; a pair of shiny heeled shoes. A pair of crisp black stockings with white ribbons. A set of long, black gloves with similar ribbons. A gorgeous lacy white apron atop a black dress with frilled white accents around the sleeves and collar. And of course, a maid's cap.

Immediately Zack noticed that this maid's uniform was far more extravagant than the one the old woman was wearing. The kind of outfit you'd see girls wearing at a Halloween party, except much more authentic looking. As if the master of the house had this made with the intent that his maids would look cute while cleaning his house, while itself being both usable and sturdy. That still didn't explain why the old woman's outfit was so much more antiquated. He had tried to imagine her in such an outfit, but...

Speaking of the old woman, her tone shifted back into a more accustomed annoyance. "Well, what are you waiting for? Change into the uniform so you can help me clean up your mess," she huffed. "Then you can help clean the rest of the house."
1132.title: Zack is paralyzed in fear

choices: Time to meet the Master of the house
Start cleaning with the dirtiest place: The Attic
11321.content:
Zack backed away, clutching his still throbbing hand. "Y-you got the wrong g-" but by then, the old woman had seen through his intentions to flee. Her face seemed even more exasperated than before. "Very well, dear. You leave me no choice."

The old maid lunged out like a cougar, reeling in Zack's good hand, and effortlessly lifted him off his feet with one arm. Zack may have been terrified of her before, but he was outright flipping his lid at this point. No further emotion seemed to cross the woman's mind as with similar speed she tossed Zack right into the cabinet. The gorgeous maid's uniform seemed to reach out like a catcher's mitt as it stopped Zack cold in his tracks. What looked like a fairly small cabinet seemed to stretch out forever in all directions. Zack's last thought was to try and run away with all his might, but by then it was too late. The maid's uniform held a tighter and tighter grip on him as the cabinet's doors were slammed shut.

Zack's heart lept out his chest. All he could see was pure darkness while his body quivered with the feeling of a thousand snakes slithering all over his cold flesh. He tried to shut his eyes and count down from three. Maybe this was just a nightmare, and he had fallen asleep in the kitchen. This is what he would have liked to believe, but the slithering feeling was doing no favors. It felt warmer and warmer, the slithering getting faster and faster. For a brief moment it stopped. He tried taking deep breaths but his chest felt tight, as if something was coiled around it. Then his feet felt like little snakes were constricting them. The cabinet had woken up again, perhaps after a little yawn. Zack's mind and body couldn't take much more of this and he finally passed out.

When he woke up again he was surprised to be able to actually see. His eyes itched and burned but there was actual light. He tried to spin around on his heels to get a clear view of where he was but they wouldn't budge. Nothing would! Except for his head, it seemed. As if jostled by his awakening, Zack's body started to move on its own and towards a full mirror, as if toying with the poor boy's emotions. He knew all too soon that the boxom girl walking towards the mirror was him. His nose wriggled trying to rid itself the scent of a sweet perfume while a full set of lashes shyly peeked out underneath a row of bangs. His rosy pursed lips begged to be kissed. Somehow he had transformed into a very pretty little maid, but his body gave him little time to think about the hows or whys.

It was time to go to work.
11321.title: Zack needs a little push

choices: The maid comes back with towels and hot chocolate
The maid comes back with the owner of the house
The guys take a quick look around
12.content:
The rain was pounding as the trio made their way to the front door of the imposing building. As they approached, the icy water felt like it was pulling the heat right out of their bodies as they wrapped their arms around themselves for warmth. Sam pounded on the large door then looked back to Alex.

“B...b...beats staying in t...t...the car, huh?” Sam shivered.

“Hey, it w...w...as your idea,” Alex spit back weakly.

After a short time, the door opened. Standing just inside, was on older woman in a maid uniform.

“Hi, our c...car broke d...down. Could we use your phone?” Asked Sam, pulling some of his long black hair out of his eyes.

The maid's eyes were wide when she almost yelled. “Get in here this instant, you three will catch the death of cold out there like that.”

She rushed them inside like a mother hen with her chicks. The three stepped into the main entrance area had everything you’d expect to see: chairs, coffee table, big clocks, there was even a large creepy portrait of a Black haired woman sitting on a chair with a brown haired man standing behind her, touching her shoulders. There was something odd about that painting, but they couldn't put their collective finger on it. The main feature of the room was the two staircases leading to a balcony. Everything was immaculately clean.

“Now, I'll be right back. Stay here, please.” She said with a smile With that she quickly scooted out of the room leaving the boys dripping dry, hugging their chests.
12.title: A warm welcome

choices: The man tells them to follow him
The owner of the Manor greats them
The lights flicker and the man is gone
13.content:
The trio steeled themselves then made a dash for the front door of the manor on the hill, the cold rain chilling them to the bone. Sam reached the door first and hammered on it with a soaked fist. Same expected to hear a solid “thunk” but the sound was loud and hollow. All three of them took a step back hearing the near unnatural noise echo all around them.

Slowly the door opened, revealing behind it a tall thin man. His skin was pale and wrinkled while he was dressed in a suit that must have been black a one point but had become gray and aged. He towered over them, his posture rigid and his face expressionless.

“Hi, our c...car broke d...down. Could we use your phone?” Asked Sam, pulling some of his long black hair out of his eyes.

The man stood there, his face showing no emotion at all. They all just stood there looking at each other for a long while before Sam opened his mouth to speak again. Before he could say anything, however, the man simply stepped back weakly gesturing for them to enter.

With a small bit of trepidation they entered.
13.title: A creepy welcome

A car breaks down in front of an ominous looking manor during a thunderstorm. The three guys in the car decide to take a look inside the building and find out too late that there are outside forces that wish for them to appear and act like woman.

Sam: The would be leader of the group. Long black Hair. 19 years old

Alex: The rebel, does what he wants. Shaggy Red Hair. 18 years old

Zack: The beta, shy and soft spoken. Short brown Hair. 18 years old


Rules:

Keep to the idea of one or all of the characters are forced to dress and act like woman.

Absolutely nothing related to children (under 18 years old)
